text.section: The Board shall waive the requirements for certification for an applicant to practice alcohol and drug counseling if the applicant meets the requirements of this section.

If the applicant is licensed or certified to practice as an associate counselor-alcohol and drug, the Board shall grant a waiver under this section only if the applicant:
Is licensed or certified in another state, territory, or jurisdiction that has requirements that are equivalent to or exceed the requirements of § 17-403 of this subtitle;
Submits an application to the Board on a form that the Board requires; and
Pays to the Board an application fee set by the Board.

If the applicant is licensed or certified to practice as a supervised counselor-alcohol and drug, the Board shall grant a waiver under this section only if the applicant:
Is licensed or certified in another state, territory, or jurisdiction that has requirements that are equivalent to or exceed the requirements of § 17-404 of this subtitle;
Submits an application to the Board on a form that the Board requires; and
Pays to the Board an application fee set by the Board.
The Board shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
